summary: Elizabeth L. Berning was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She is listed in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. These documents detail her inclusion in the committee's payroll, indicating her role as a staff member during that period. The reports list her name, salary, and pay earned during the specified periods.
significance: Elizabeth L. Berning's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, contributing to the committee's investigation, although the specific nature of her role is not detailed in the provided documents.
